website_summaries.verdict: This is a small router with a lot of punch that will cover a large condo or a small house.
pros: With multiple hardware ports for LAN or USB connections, wireless speeds of up to 1900 Mbps, and the ability to control it from your wireless device, this router scores big
cons: The setup is straight forward as long as you follow the manual, otherwise it will be confusing

website_summaries.verdict: For advanced and professional users, the Asus RT-AC68U Dual-band Wireless-AC1900 Gigabit Router is worth every penny thanks to its stellar performance, solid build, and bounty of useful features.
pros: The Asus RT-AC68U Dual-band Wireless-AC1900 Gigabit Router features powerful hardware, faster Wi-Fi technology, and useful features
The router delivers in all categories
cons: The Asus RT-AC68U is expensive, not wall-mountable, and not everyone will immediately benefit from its new and faster Wi-Fi standards

website_summaries.verdict: The Asus RT-AC68U Dual-band Wireless-AC1900 Gigabit Router is an excellent performer and shows that Asus's 802.11ac technology has matured since the release of the RT-AC66U. While it's stellar in 802.11ac mode, those with 802.11n-only clients may not see much benefit over its predecessor.
pros: Topped our speed and range tests in 802.11ac mode
Advanced features suited for small business
cons: Not much benefit over previous models for networks with only 802.11n wireless clients
No automatic notification of new firmware

customer_reviews.title: ASUS ac68u WOW
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as my virgin media hub2 didn’t give the WiFi coverage I required. I set my hub2 into modem mode and plugged in the ASUS router. Set is fairly straight forward, plus you download an app for Android and iOS to control your router setting and view stats. I’m on a 200mb package, I can now achieve download speeds of 220mb via 5g wifi anywhere in the house. Even at the bottom of the garden I’m hitting 142mb and the router is at the opposite side of the house. No more black spots, no more power line adaptors. Just super internet .
customer_reviews.author: Craig Williams

customer_reviews.title: NOT TOO BAD
customer_reviews.text: Fist time owning an asus router very easy set up if you get stuck there are lots of how to do videos on YouTube. Wifi range isn't much better than Virgin super hub 2 but faster speeds probably down to my settings. Overall I'm happy with it . Another note I got open nat on Xbox one without having to port forward or alter any settings (wired connection). I'm on 100mb fibre from Virgin and got 112mb download and 7.5 mb upload on 5ghz wifi and 53mb download and 6.7upload on 2.5ghz with a ping of 16 and 26.
customer_reviews.author: Gbro

customer_reviews.title: Straight forward to setup
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a wifi hub that i could setup out of the box and the ASUS fit the bill. The instructions were easy to follow and i was able to connect to the Virgin media in a matter of minutes. So im happy with this product
customer_reviews.author: Mr. R. Flatters

customer_reviews.title: Great product for its price.
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to set up and works a treat. Good for its price.. also allows for vpn across all devices that connect without issue. The main router wouldn't accept all devices, without dropping another device. This router has worked flawlessly, allowing internet access to everything at the same time, while giving the benefit of vpn access (needs to be set up) Not that I intend to take it on holiday, but interchangeable UK/European shoes on the psu is a nice feature..
customer_reviews.author: Mr P A Boland

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant router
customer_reviews.text: I own a Asus dsl ac68u and needed to make a mesh network due to poor WiFi signal. Plugged this in performed a system reboot and my router picked it up straight away. Had no issues with it since it has been plugged in and has given me wifi into the garden and halfway down the road
customer_reviews.author: Del2ooo

customer_reviews.title: ASUS support is worse than useless
customer_reviews.text: This purchase was to pair with the same model, bought a few years ago (old model can be upgraded to the same firmware as the new one, to enable AiMesh). However the old one's firmware would not flash. It took two weeks of incompetence from ASUS before they finally came clean and told me they could not help with the firmware flash problem. Very poor process (they did not read e-mails and took two days to reply each time) and general incompetence
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This are Great.... if you get working ones..
customer_reviews.text: I liked the RTAC-68U's and I recommend them to everyone how ever when I went to order them to replace ageing 10/100 Old AP's and upgrade to the new AI mesh System I received both 2 Dogey units where the 2.4GHZ band would just randomly stop and not work again until you turned it off and back on again this would happen at random times sometimes 6 hours would go or even 10 mins However this was probably down to a dogey bunch that I ended up getting however I would recommend these if you get working ones
customer_reviews.author: max

customer_reviews.title: Bought As AiMesh Node
customer_reviews.text: I have an ASUS AC86U in my hall which replaced the god awful ‘Smart’ Hub 2 from BT. Whilst the wifi signal is good, I had a substantial drop in signal in our master bedroom upstairs. Getting the AC68U and setting it up as a AiMesh Node has fixed it. Luckily I had an ethernet cable routed up stairs years ago so I have it hardwired and the connection is rock solid.
customer_reviews.author: Alistair Mccann

customer_reviews.title: VPN client is slow
customer_reviews.text: I bought this router to use the built-in VPN client. It was much slower than the VPN clients on my devices. This seems to be a general problem for all VPN routers. I’ve the same issue using a Raspberry Pi 4B as a router. Depending on how well Asus answers my query regarding this issue will make me give a better score and I won’t send it back, which is looking more likely. Disappointed at this stage but we’ll see.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for Virgin users
customer_reviews.text: Ideal router if you want an upgrade from your standard ISP supplied hardware. I use this alongside the Virgin Media router (in modem mode). Easy to set up and lots of features of you like to tinker with your network settings. Would have liked MU-MIMO for what I paid, and would be nice if you could have one SSID for both bands (rather than separate 5g network).
customer_reviews.author: Jon Munson

customer_reviews.title: Unlucky or a problem
customer_reviews.text: Its a problem this is my second, poor batch, or poor product sick of returning stuff, spent 2 hours trying to get this to work. More for me for trying, if it doesn't not work out of the box return it for a refund, i made the mistake of trying another, same problem, tried on different computer, different operating system, different cables, all which work with other routers.
customer_reviews.author: CB

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Router, solved all my network issues
customer_reviews.text: I've suffered long standing network and wifi issues using Netgear over the past few years and I recently upgraded to a Netgear R7000. ALL the problems continued. So I sent it back and bought my first ASUS (RT-AC68U) instead. It solved all my long standing network and Wi-Fi issues. This is a great router, the web interface and mobile app or streets ahead of Netgear and the internet performance is excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended
customer_reviews.text: Really good Wifi router. Used this to replace the router part of the very limited Virgin Media Hub 3.0 (which is now in modem mode) Config is easy and menus are very detailed with all sorts things to tweek. It seems like the original VM Hub 3 struggled with >100Mbs on Wifi (and wired! - all Gigabit connections) whereas with this I often see 220Mbs while downloading on my main PC. While I have many (20) devices connected (IOT, phones, Alexas etc) most of these are not doing any transfers. It would appear the Hub 3.0 in router mode is a limiting factor on throughput.
customer_reviews.author: Nick K

customer_reviews.title: Great router
customer_reviews.text: I've had the router a week and it's been rock solid. Previously I had a Virgin Media superhub and suffered from regular disconnects from my Sonos speakers and iPhone. Since having this I haven't had any connection issues, wifi signal around the house has improved significantly as well- rooms where I couldn't get a solid wifi signal before connect perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Vk Sehijpal

customer_reviews.title: Solid router with decent performance / features
customer_reviews.text: Solid as a rock - highly recommended. Used to replace my ISP replaced router, which was a little flaky (requiring a reboot once every few days) specifically with WiFi 5ghz performance. Since installing the Asus I've not had to reboot the router once due to instability and it's been in for about 3 months. Wireless range and performance has been on point.
customer_reviews.author: PM

customer_reviews.title: Asus great firmware, reliable and fast.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this router recently to replace a Netgear R7000. I was generally happy with the R7000 but I recently upgraded to BT TV and discovered that it didn't work with the R7000 as it doesn't support Multicast/IP TV. The RT-AC68U works fine with BT TV and provides similar WiFi performance and range to the Netgear R7000. The firmware/software interface is much better on the Asus than the Netgear and has significantly more features and monitoring capabilities. The Adaptive QOS works well and is very easy to configure, the Asus AI protection is also useful to stop people going on websites that contain viruses/spyware etc. Overall very happy and will likely buy another Asus router in the future.
customer_reviews.author: P. C. Farrar

customer_reviews.title: Amazing value, great price.
customer_reviews.text: I’m very satisfied, I’ve been using for more than a 1 year now, and there wasn’t a single issue with it. Very easy to set it up and the signal is great, I can walk around the house outside in the garden and I got good signal. In the house the download and upload is flawless.
customer_reviews.author: Norbert Rapcsak

customer_reviews.title: Bought this as my Virgin Super hub couldn't cope with the introduction of smart home ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as my Virgin Super hub couldn't cope with the introduction of smart home devices and the numerous tablets and phones in the house. This is a breath of fresh air. No more reboots and loss of Wi-Fi, some good tools on-board when you log in to it. Set up MAC address filtering, renaming devices, grouping the kids devices together and putting them on a separate network with the ability of blocking their devices at bed time. Much faster too and no more dead spots around the house or garden.
customer_reviews.author: Simon N Gresty

customer_reviews.title: Great performance
customer_reviews.text: This ASUS router is an excellent choice for the modern home. This most recent purchase is connected to my existing AC68U to create a mesh network using the ASUS AI-Mesh system. Easy to set up and the user interface is very detailed, whether logging-in from a PC or using the smartphone app.
customer_reviews.author: Craig W.

customer_reviews.title: Good value, reliable and easy to set up.
customer_reviews.text: With a very unreliable internet service and an ISP supplied router my home network would be unavailable for long stretches at a time. The ASUS router was very easy to set up and configure and setting my ISP router to modem mode means I can still use my home network even when my internet service is down. Well worth the money and gives a great strong signal all over the house.
customer_reviews.author: Chizling

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Router
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic router. Purchased it to replace my older Draytek router that was plugged into my Virgin router/modem. It has an absolutely stunning WiFi range, and looks really good. Very easy to setup - but I work in IT, so most of these things are pretty easy! I was aware that there were newer versions available, but this version is faster than my Virgin 150Mbps cable connection, so no need to get a faster one for me. Also, I really wanted one that stood vertically on the cabinet, rather than being a horizontal version.
customer_reviews.author: Andy Ward

customer_reviews.title: Very high wifi drop out rate
customer_reviews.text: 11 out of 100 so far rate this product as i do. It gives great expectation but i have found it to be so very disappointing. The frequency of drop out when acting as a node to another ASUS router is extremely high, basically it holds the wifi signal for a couple fo hours then fails. Asus tech support is (as other have said) worse than useless, both in terms of on line 'chat' and actual telephone contact. strongly suggest any looks at other mesh systems before considering ASUS.
customer_reviews.author: gbeesley

customer_reviews.title: All in all a good router for a decent price considering what you get.
customer_reviews.text: It does it's job well and for the price it works absolutely fine ,signal strength is good , and it's not difficult to set-up, there are quite a lot of features and there are good alternative firmwares available if you don't want to use the included one.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. P. Baker

customer_reviews.title: Super router!
customer_reviews.text: Great VPN performance, feature-rich, powerful UI. It becomes even more powerful after upgrading to AsusWRT-Merlin; the upgrade process is piece of cake!
customer_reviews.author: Panagiotis

customer_reviews.title: I love it
customer_reviews.text: Its good. I have my auto fail-over working for my broadband. It copes with PCI (Payment Card industry - Visa/Mastercard) penetration tests so the firewall must be up to spec. Wireless is a huge upgrade on the old virgin superhub I had previously even with older devices. It does need to loose its connection with Virgin sometimes which never seemed to happen with my Virgin router. Copes well with my 160M connection Handles my 4G dongle immediately with no config Im still exploring extra features but as a wifi failover router its great,
customer_reviews.author: C. Errington

customer_reviews.title: Solid as a rock
customer_reviews.text: There are plenty of reviews and data on the multitude of features of this router. For me, it was simply based on range. I was using an Apple Airport Extreme before and if you tried to use an iPad at the far end of the house you were out of luck. With the ASUS I no longer have that problem. Setup was an absolute breeze and I have now even started using some of the more advanced features. I know my way around computers but I am no expert on networking and this simple enough for me to use with ease. Highly recommended
customer_reviews.author: PsychoDeli

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working 14 Months after purchase
customer_reviews.text: I bought this model for use as an AI-Mesh node. It worked great for nearly 14 months, then just stopped. I can't even reset it to manufacturer default, neither I can use it as a normal router. Greatly disappointing, I though Asus was a quality brand with solid reputation.
customer_reviews.author: M. Mohammed

customer_reviews.title: Superb device
customer_reviews.text: Superb device, the only point I noticed is that you can not manage vpn via app and you have to log in to admin consul. If they add this then I'll give it 10 stars
customer_reviews.author: Rouzbeh

customer_reviews.title: Great router
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic router. So much better than the talk talk router supplied when we went to fibre broadband it makes a nonsense of the junk they supply. Thought my belkin router was good but we are getting 25mb around most of the house, where before we were getting literally nothing with the talktalk router. Am using an openreach fibre modem on talktalk and this is what you need if you are unimpressed with what they supply. IPlayer works great now on the TV about 15m away, whilst other computers are also downloading elsewhere in the house.
customer_reviews.author: MikeC

customer_reviews.title: The ports have gone bad. None of the ports speed show gigabit despite ...
customer_reviews.text: I had this for 2.5 years. The ports have gone bad. None of the ports speed show gigabit despite using CAT 6 cables on a gigabit capable ethernet directly connected to the router. I tried lots of 5e and cat6 cables. It hurts that it did not even last 3 years. So much for paying almost 175 quid. It is time to to stay clear of consumer routers.
customer_reviews.author: SanDan

customer_reviews.title: Perfect ... Glad I chose this one!
customer_reviews.text: Having had only positive experiences of Asus equipment and after reading many reviews I decided to settle on this router to replace the one supplied by our broadband provider. It proved easy to set up, it is fast and has a much wider coverage than our previous model. I also particularly like the software/web page used for configuration. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Nick M

customer_reviews.title: Rock solid reliability, great range, high performance, and useful extra features.  Buy it!
customer_reviews.text: Rock solid reliability, fast connection, long range, and useful extra features like the built in FTP server and guest WiFi network support. Not much I can write that has not already been written. I use this as an access point to a fibre to the premises broadband modem, and it simply works. Reliably. And doesn't need rebooting for months on end. My wife's iPad Air connects to the 5 GHz 'AC' band, and has truly brilliant throughput well over 100 Mbps. Highly recommend this router. It's not cheap, but it really works.
customer_reviews.author: AtomicDoctor

customer_reviews.title: Good substitute for using alongside the Virgin Superhub or any cable router the ISPs provide
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to use alongside my Virgin Superhub as i was fed up with the lousy wireless and having to reset the superhub every 3 days. This router worked straight out of the box and only took about 10mins to set up to my specifications. The pages on the router are easy to access and displayed clearly. Only quibble i have with it is having to update the software so often and if you don't it causes havoc with connections and wireless dropout.
customer_reviews.author: Foster Major

customer_reviews.title: Great upgrade for BT Home Hub 3
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to upgrade BT Home Hub 3, which was giving us unreliable WiFi coverage around the home. It was almost a plug and play replacement - you need to continue to use the BT Openreach modem (white box) and swap out the BT Home Hub 3 router. The one challenge was getting the router setup wizard to log on to BT Infinity broadband. Eventually worked out that you don't use your BT account login: you use bthomehub@btbroadband.com as the username and any character (I used *) as the password. Once that was sorted, the wifi network worked extremely well with fast speeds throughout the house and no more dropping out.
customer_reviews.author: paul_n

customer_reviews.title: Excellent router
customer_reviews.text: I recently got Virgin Media. The Virgin superhub is fine, but this one allows a little more control. You can have guest networks, etc, etc (see full specs). You can also see not only how much data you have downloaded, but also how much you have uploaded too. In the event that a virus takes over your computer and decides to send your files to someone else, you would be able to see that there is way to much data being transmitted. (I know, I know, I'm paranoid.)
customer_reviews.author: S. Allen

customer_reviews.title: Great router especially for use with ASUS Merlin WRT
customer_reviews.text: Excellent fast router, even better when you install ASUS Merlin WRT custom firmware and a breeze to set up vpn’s on.
customer_reviews.author: D. Morris

customer_reviews.title: Lives up to expectations...
customer_reviews.text: ..seems to do everything it should...plenty of connectivity and using a USB3 1Tb external drive plugged into the USB3 port you can then access media anywhere on your network. It is also easy to manage compared with previous routers I have been used to. Definitely well worth the money for convenience and peace of mind.
customer_reviews.author: Trickcyclist

customer_reviews.title: Review
customer_reviews.text: An excellent router, but far too expensive. Easy to set up and administer. USB 3 connection for attaching a USB drive. (I must admit to having some concerns about leaving a portable drive permanently connected, as its running continuously. Are these drives really up to constant operation?) To be honest, unless you are using AC wireless ancillaries, this router offers little benefit over much cheaper models, other than future proofing. Seems well made to me.
customer_reviews.author: MikeP

customer_reviews.title: Excellent wireless router
customer_reviews.text: Excellent router, a massive improvement on the Virgin Superhub I was using for my wireless broadband.(you still need to use the superhub in 'modem only' mode' and use the AC68U for the wireless portion). I spend a lot of time travelling with work and this router allows you to set up your own secure VPN connection from your foreign location, which allows you to stream English TV to your remote device. Performance wise - I upgraded the network card in my laptop and working in combo with the router means the wireless supports wireless rates of over 100Mbps. The signal strength is also very good.
customer_reviews.author: Fuzzy_logic

customer_reviews.title: Great now firmware is mature
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic router, will just add to the rest of the recent reviews of this product in that as of recent firmware, the router is really stable and performs wonderfully. Wireless AC performance on my iPad Air 2 is phenomenal, get great speeds all over the house but the router is situated quite centrally so a good spread of signal. Got mine for less than £140 when the price was lower so feel like I had a bargain.
customer_reviews.author: Vaarky

customer_reviews.title: its better than the standard modem
customer_reviews.text: Im using it for a gaming PC, has to be wireless, so am using the Asus instead,its plugged into the router ethernet port. its better than the standard modem, as good as wired!!
customer_reviews.author: andy crellin

customer_reviews.title: What a difference in Speed!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this (& the Asus USB-AC56 Wireless USB Network Interface Card) because the wi-fi speed I was getting from Virginmedia was only 15Mb (as opposed to the 150 Mb on a wired connection). What a change. Having attached this as a router to the Virgin Superhub (as a modem), I am now enjoying wifi of between 110 & 160 Mb. What a difference. The Router was very easy to set up and I would highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: dfscot

customer_reviews.title: WiFi all over the house? Yes please.
customer_reviews.text: Works a treat and covers a medium sized family home with no issues. I even wall mounted it with some custom mounts I found on ebay.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Broadbent

customer_reviews.title: Airplay Saviour !
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to setup. I had to take the plunge as my 4 year old daughter was firing up my Hi-Fi Airplay system at full volume with her ipod. After the third incident of Phineas and Ferb at full volume ( 7am sunday morning) I decided a router with a guest network was the only solution. This router can support many guest networks thus keeping the kids away from my Airplay devices.
customer_reviews.author: Airpix

customer_reviews.title: Life changing
customer_reviews.text: Reasonably priced and stopped months of my frustrations with a rubbish router delivered by the internet provider. I have been using Asus for months with multiple devices older and newer. No problems.
customer_reviews.author: SB

customer_reviews.title: Great Product!
customer_reviews.text: I was having issues with my business network so decided to try the ASUS as a replacement. I bought 1 to see how it would work and was that impressed i repaced all my Access Points (AP) with the ASUS. I originally had 5 AP's and 5 switches for my network but now only need 3 ASUS's. The range/area is very good and i can allow customer acess with saftly too.i.e. not being able to acess my system. I also had problems acessing my old network with some of my new blackerry passport phones, this isn't an issue anymore! So yes i'm very happy with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Solid, Fast, Reliable, Trustworthy.
customer_reviews.text: Very good 2.4GHz and 5GHz throughput throughout my two story 4 bedroom block/brick walled house. Excellent OPENVPN client performance, 40mbps + whereas my old n66u could only manage 10mbps Orginally purchased the Netgear R7000, this Asus ac68u is by far a better device, the Netgear firmware configuration options are crap in comparison to what you can do on this Asus router. I did try a forked version of the Asus firmware on the R7000 but the wireless performance was no where near as consistently good as on this Asus router. I was going to buy the ac87u but kept hearing of many issues with it so got the ac68u instead, very happy I did.
customer_reviews.author: WAA MACKIE

customer_reviews.title: Top quality product
customer_reviews.text: Brilliant Router, easy to setup and very impressive when it is working. Strong Wifi and fast.
customer_reviews.author: philip12352

customer_reviews.title: Cannot selectively hide main SSID and show Guest
customer_reviews.text: Used by small cafe to assist in PCI DSS compliance using the guest wifi facility to give public wifi. Disappointed not to be able to selectively hide/disable the main wifi SSID without also hiding the guest wifi. Hence 4 stars only. This seems an incomprehensibly stupid design decision. Otherwise an excellent product..
customer_reviews.author: Barcud Coch {Powys)

customer_reviews.title: Fast, powerful router!
customer_reviews.text: I was getting extremely fed up with my BT HomeHub 3's poor WiFi coverage and slow connection speed so decided it was time to invest in a decent router which would last me a few years. As I had predicted, this solved my wireless coverage problem and supports my AC wifi devices (iPhones, iMacs etc).
customer_reviews.author: Lawrence

customer_reviews.title: Works great but not a huge range - no better range ...
customer_reviews.text: Works great but not a huge range - no better range than my old home hub 2. Make sure you change the settings to use 40 hz bandwidth 2.4 . This is what makes the throughput v v fast - I now get up to 70meg, otherwise is just like any other good router. This probably wont work if you live in a very congested area e.g flat in London (for more info google "good neighbour policy")
customer_reviews.author: Chris B

customer_reviews.title: Consistent fast WIFI
customer_reviews.text: I've got a BT home hub that due to the ineptitude of the BT development teams has a bug that means it keeps dropping the iPhone or any mobile connection on the WIFI. So I looked for an alternative and this was recommended. Turned it on and it worked perfectly 1st time so easy to configure and now I have a consistent connection on all my devices at home
customer_reviews.author: Pavel Kricka

customer_reviews.title: Dissapointed
customer_reviews.text: The wifi range was very surprisingly not much better than my virginmedia superhub, which was the sole reason I'd bought it. Added to that the fact that it locked up and needed rebooting after only one day, I sent it immediately back for a refund. I suspect amazon may have sent me a refurbished item that was not in 100% working condition.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. R. Merlo

customer_reviews.title: Faulty so returned for refund
customer_reviews.text: After fighting with this for a couple of weeks, it turned out the router was constantly dropping wireless clients so I reset it and returned it for a refund. Online resources were often '404' not found and somewhat out of date, even after a firmware upgrade.
customer_reviews.author: MT

customer_reviews.title: The advertised 3g/4g usb dongle support is very poor. Tried multiple dongles in various configurations (all work ...
customer_reviews.text: The advertised 3g/4g usb dongle support is very poor. Tried multiple dongles in various configurations (all work fine when plugged directly into my PC) but even when I did get it working the connection is prone to randomly lock up when loading certain pages. The rest of the router seems to work fine, but I'd look elsewhere if you need to share a 4g connection.
customer_reviews.author: David Faulkner

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: Nice router, fast and reliable but not as easy to setup as my last Asus router.
customer_reviews.author: cmklein

customer_reviews.title: Pixel 2 XL and Virgin Superhub 2 users - this will fix your wifi problems.
customer_reviews.text: Pixel 2 XL and Virgin Superhub 2 users - this will fix your wifi problems. I went from losing wifi every X minutes to it being rock solid. Very easy to set up, great admin interface, and very good speed/reach.
customer_reviews.author: RH

customer_reviews.title: Keeps losing signal
customer_reviews.text: I don't know if I keep doing something wrong or if someone could spread some info, but mine keeps dropping off wi fi signal and signal to my desktop mini mac. Very annoying to say the least considering how much it cost. Then to top it off , it won't let me log in with the password and admin log in.....
customer_reviews.author: wuzza

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set-up & use - I would have given ...
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set-up & use - I would have given 5 Stars, but my unit froze/hung on a daily basis - even when there was no one at home using the internet. The only way out was to power off/on again I also tried a factory reset, and also loaded the latest firmware, but that didn't stop the unit freezing/hanging I have RMA'd the unit, and I'm waiting for a RT-AC87U
customer_reviews.author: _Tom_

customer_reviews.title: good UI to set up the router
customer_reviews.text: Reliable connection, speedy wireless LAN, good UI to set up the router. If you have devices that can take advantage of the 802.11ac wireless standard, I recommend this router. Note: router only, does not have an in-built modem.
customer_reviews.author: JP

customer_reviews.title: Great router
customer_reviews.text: Using as an access point and getting very good data rates even on an iPhone. Bear in mind this is a router/ AP only. No modem.
customer_reviews.author: bobwat

customer_reviews.title: fantastic router with the best interface i've ever used
customer_reviews.text: fantastic router with the best interface i've ever used. access from computer or phone, do everything you want, including renaming all the devices on your network so they are easier to identify, a feature i've wanted for years.
customer_reviews.author: New car, caviar, four star daydream

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Worked for a couple of months than started going offline & needed resetting/rebooting.
customer_reviews.author: MR2010

customer_reviews.title: its wireless range is not as good in proportion to its price
customer_reviews.text: I think reviews are a bit over rated the product. its wireless range is not as good in proportion to its price. However, I like how it does not heat up as most routers when in under high traffic. It definitely improves the pings and speed when gaming via wired connection. PS. I use it in an environment with loads of interference from other radio devices.
customer_reviews.author: Bane

customer_reviews.title: Love this. I've bought the previous model and now ...
customer_reviews.text: Love this. I've bought the previous model and now taken that to the office and use this at home. The range is good enough (not amazing, but goes from the front of a mid-terrace to the middle of the garden and still allows streaming) and facilities are really good, with an easy-to-use GUI.
customer_reviews.author: marky_uk

customer_reviews.title: 4GHz and 5GHz wireless networks and both are great.
customer_reviews.text: Have two of these in the house. One attached to modem for BT Infinity and one as a repeater to ensure coverage. Software/UI is amongst the easiest I have used (and I have had a lot of routers) and performance is right up there. Currently running 2.4GHz and 5GHz wireless networks and both are great.
customer_reviews.author: Philip Sweetman

customer_reviews.title: Very reliable so far, but quite big.
customer_reviews.text: Had this router several months and so far been very reliable. Kids are happy :-)
customer_reviews.author: Neil Wallace

customer_reviews.title: Need more power and easy set up? Buy this right now.
customer_reviews.text: Absolute monster of a router. I routinely get 240mbit down and 25mbit up over Wifi (i'm with Virgin Media and paying for 250mbit down and 25 up). I have 11 devices connected and the signal strength is superb. Also, I just plugged it into my modem and off we went. If you do want to fiddle with the settings, it has one of the better UIs I've seen in a router. Also, and this is the icing on the cake, you can disable all the flashing lights on the front, which means my curious toddler ignores it entirely! Brilliant feature!
customer_reviews.author: James Nesbitt

customer_reviews.title: Best router I have owned
customer_reviews.text: Excellent rock-solid router: Pros: * Able to set up multiple networks including guest networks with limited access * Good USB3 support * Absolutely rock-solid connection Cons: * Might have too MANY features for some users.
customer_reviews.author: CGK

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Massive improvement from my old router and I get solid signal and better speeds in rooms where I had nothing before. If you are unsure about setting it up or run into problems do look into guides as the options are plentiful on this one!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best router I've owned
customer_reviews.text: Best router I've owned, bar none. It improved wifi speed and stability within the house. And I can also prioritise wireless AC at 5 GHz to get best possible speeds. The QoS didn't really work well, so it's disabled. But I've found this as a flaw in D LINK, Netgear, Linksys. No one has ever properly cracked it. So I can't mark it down for something which isn't needed or useful to me.
customer_reviews.author: Loren Jennings

customer_reviews.title: Good app to control it
customer_reviews.text: Much better than my ISP supplied router. Much more control via app and reliable signal
customer_reviews.author: A. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Very good. Plenty of instructions to follow
customer_reviews.text: Very good. Plenty of instructions to follow, be too advanced for me but does what i want it too. Range improved hell of a lot 2.4ghz but 5.0ghz still weak. I've been told you cant improve 5ghz no matter what due to 5ghz never been designed to use across different rooms. Overall would recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: RMR Nawaz

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant, easy to set up. Excellent wifi coverage around the house.
customer_reviews.text: Brilliant and esay to set up router to extend wifi coverage around my house. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Archie

customer_reviews.title: This Router is amazing. I've always encountered WiFi drop outs with the ...
customer_reviews.text: This Router is amazing. I've always encountered WiFi drop outs with the Superhub 2 ac (virgin Media), but with this router, since purchase (3 Apr 2015), I've still not experienced a single dropped connection. Asus is an amazing manufacturer of hardware, and doesn't disappoint with this Router. I am using an Asus PCE-AC68 wifi card in my PC, so wireless AC works perfectly!
customer_reviews.author: Eddie Simpson

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to set-up with a great web interface
customer_reviews.text: I was having issues getting a wireless signal from my Virgin router in some parts of the house (less than 100kb) so I bought the AC68U and an ASUS USB-AC56 adapter to try to improve things. WOW! I now get over 60 Mbs in all rooms and on every attached device, even devices using 802.11g. Very high quality bit of kit. Very easy to set-up with a great web interface. This box does everything and does them all very well.
customer_reviews.author: K. Balaam

customer_reviews.title: Good router. Had it for a while now
customer_reviews.text: Good router. Had it for a while now. If you find some AC or 5GHz products cannot see it.. change the channel! Some products only support some channels, such as my LG TV. Works fine and is stable!
customer_reviews.author: C Noble

customer_reviews.title: Pricey but worth it.
customer_reviews.text: Although pricey this is an excellent dual band router. Great coverage throughout my 3 bedroom semi-detached house. Speed is remarkable. I have this linked wirelessly to my PC that has an Asus wireless card and speed is as good as wired. It's just about worth the price and firmware up dates have improved the user interface.
customer_reviews.author: Big AL zz

customer_reviews.title: good WiFi range and performance
customer_reviews.text: Rock solid, fast router. Using with Virgin Media Superhub v2 in Modem Mode for blazing fast and stable internet connectivity with 13 clients connected. Never needs rebooting, good WiFi range and performance.
customer_reviews.author: silkstrade

customer_reviews.title: best value asus router on the market currently.
customer_reviews.text: very good router, probably the best value asus router to buy currently as the ac87 isnt a whole lot better on paper and has some firmware bugs still whilst the ac68 has stable firmware.
customer_reviews.author: C. Collins

customer_reviews.title: Amazing piece of kit
customer_reviews.text: Amazing piece of kit. I was having trouble with the amount of devices connecting to the Sky router that they supply you. I plugged this in and switched it to AP mode and turned the WiFi off on the Sky router and voila, max speed for all devices and no slow-downs. Brilliant.
customer_reviews.author: Marcus O'Brien

customer_reviews.title: Great speeds
customer_reviews.text: Using it as NAS repeater, transfer speeds are great. Repeating on 5Ghz and conneting through 2.4Ghz. Thinking of getting another dual band to extend more. Fight back those damn BT hubs taking all channels everywhere ya go.
customer_reviews.author: Neurall Glade

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: It was a gift for my boyfriend and he loved so I am happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Angela

customer_reviews.title: Huge improvement in VM speed
customer_reviews.text: This router improved my virgin media connection from 45-60mbit/s to 270mbit/s through most of my 4 bedroom house. Well worth the investment!!
customer_reviews.author: MR SIMON J POLE

customer_reviews.title: Excellent router
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this top-of-the-range router to supplement a Sky supplied modem/router that was overwhelmed by the demands of a fairly basic music streaming system; it works perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Duncan Nicholson

customer_reviews.title: Great router now have wifi all over the house where ...
customer_reviews.text: Great router now have wifi all over the house where on BT router it was minimal one note though you need the white BT box for infinite for it to run, best router ever had
customer_reviews.author: Pete lewis

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant.
customer_reviews.text: Bit fiddly to set up but once I got it working with my Virgin Superhub modem it is brilliant. Very strong signal around my flat. Don't need my powerline sockets anymore. Only been using it a few days through. Think the people that gave it bad reviews didn't know how to set it up properly. Also position of the router is crucial to getting a good signal around your house.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Watt

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: WiFi speed quadrupled when I replaced provider's router with this.
customer_reviews.author: VJS

customer_reviews.title: Excellent router, provides great coverage (much better than previous ...
customer_reviews.text: Excellent router, provides great coverage (much better than previous 802.11n router) and very good admin console. Using with a fibre connection, using original Plusnet modem with this connected. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: David Martin

customer_reviews.title: Easy set up & Good signal
customer_reviews.text: High quality item that is easy to set up with good signal. If using with fibre broadband it plugs into the BT Openreach modem (we set up on Plusnet service in a matter of minutes)
customer_reviews.author: Andy R

customer_reviews.title: Probably the best home router out there
customer_reviews.text: Probably the best home router out there, supports multiple 3rd party firmwares including MerlinWRT, 5GHz signal is rock solid, doesn't drop out when using on restricted channels and covers my while period house with ease.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: best router I've used!!
customer_reviews.text: One of the best things I've bought, puts my virgin super hub to shame! Use my virgin hub as a modem now & this as my router, great signal in all rooms!!
customer_reviews.author: dolphin

customer_reviews.title: Very stable, worth the money
customer_reviews.text: I've always found buying wireless routers a little hit and miss. Sometimes you find a great one that is easy to setup and very stable; others are unstable and horrible to setup. The AC68U is in the great category. Setup was a breeze, fantastic range, and transfer speeds. I recommend looking for the custom Merlin Asus firmware. Based off the stock Asus firmware with more stability and security updates. Just make sure you read the instructions on how to update the firmware!
customer_reviews.author: Matt Hobbs

customer_reviews.title: Does everything you need and does it well.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to replace my Virgin Hub 3 and it has improved my internet no end!
customer_reviews.author: MR N R Tucker

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: Great router. I had hyperoptic's default router, and I instantly noticed improved speed and range when using this router. Super easy to set up.
customer_reviews.author: Omar El Sakka

customer_reviews.title: Works fantastic. Have tried other routers
customer_reviews.text: Works fantastic. Have tried other routers, always come back to this one. Great range.
customer_reviews.author: Miqs

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the money
customer_reviews.text: I really like this. It must buffer as video quality and integrity has shot up. We only have 10mbs. This has really helped.
customer_reviews.author: Ade

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Brilliant, really easy to install. Excellent signal strength. I've never installed my own router before and was expecting it to take hours. All done in about 20 mins. Just connect it to your modem, connect you device to the router and it has its own in built wizard that sorts out all of the settings for you. Really impressed. Not cheap, but it really is worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best ever had other Asus routers all good
customer_reviews.text: Best ever had other Asus routers all good , this one is Brilliant stable easy set up does the business, buy it you wont be diapointed
customer_reviews.author: A. Borrowman

customer_reviews.title: Great router, works very well in my Edwardian Terrace
customer_reviews.text: Great router, works very well in my Edwardian Terrace. Easy to set up and lots of features for those of a technical inclination
customer_reviews.author: Rich3

Effortless router setup with the ASUSWRT web based interface; Dual band connectivity for compatibility and performance
Monitor and manage your network with ease from your mobile device using the intuitive ASUS router app
